attributes.action: CREATE A 99p LITRE FUEL LAW MAKING IT ILLEGAL FOR COMPANYS TO CHARGE MORE
attributes.additional_details:
1. BP (BP) posted $8.5 billion in profit for in the second quarter — more than three times what it made during the same period last year. The company also said it would increase its dividends to shareholders by 10%. Shares nudged up in London Stock Exchange trading. 
2. The CEO of Tesco has denied the company is profiteering from rising fuel prices despite seeing a 44% increase in sales value to £2 billion in the first three months of the financial year.
attributes.background: Government to enforce this new law on fuel company’s who are racking in ridiculous profits while the British people struggle to get by.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for producers and retailers.
